column4: anyone help with NetworkManager? It's refusing to talk to my access point. Worked in edgy pre-nm.
so this is a system you upgraded, or a clean installation?
does it just not connect, does it give you any error?
: that's good, did you happen to read my tutorial (http://technowizah.com/2007/02/debian-how-to-managing-networks-with.html) ?
nah, a similar article elsewhere
hum... what is the output of "groups" ?
mstevens adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin
that's your problem right there: you are not part of the "netdev" group
read my tutorial: http://technowizah.com/2007/02/debian-how-to-managing-networks-with.html
trying it
ok
still swirly for a while then doesn't connect
output of "groups" again ?
now: mstevens adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin netdev
did you try to connect directly with "iwconfig"
yeah, networks displayed nicely, pick one, enter key, never authenticates
not yet...
not yet ?
I'm trying tow ork it out now :)
hmm, it doesn't connect anymore the old way, which it certainly used to
the old way? with "iwconfig" ?
with what NM calls "Manual Configuration"
